headline: Digital misinformation casts shadow on U.S.-China trade truce
description: From false claims of Americans panic-buying Chinese goods to bot-driven attacks on U.S. brands, a tide of misinformation is casting a shadow over the U.S-Chine trade dispute

headline: The divergence between US treasury yields and the dollar index: A crisis of confidence
description: The historical link between rising U.S. Treasury yields and a stronger dollar has broken in 2025, as yields surge on fiscal stress fears, not economic strength. Downgrades, declining foreign demand, and rising refinancing costs are straining markets, pressuring the dollar and equities amid economic slowdown and investor uncertainty.

headline: Lloyds Enterprises Shares Rise To Hit Four-Month High
description: The shares on Friday closed 2.57% higher after rising 4.23% to Rs 52.29 per share.

headline: Navigating the Future: Insights into the Indian Logistics Sector
description: The Indian logistics sector is poised for growth, driven by strategic international collaborations and a robust domestic market. This article delves into the sector's performance, outlook, and highlights key companies that are set to benefit from this positive trajectory.

headline: Reliance Power shares skyrocket 22% in 6 days. Should you book profits?
description: Reliance Power shares have surged 22.2% in the last six trading sessions, driven by strong Q4 FY25 results showing a net profit of Rs 126 crore compared to the previous year's loss. Technical indicators, including a 'buy' signal on the Supertrend indicator, have further boosted investor sentiment. The stock has delivered impressive 91.7% returns over the past year.

headline: Aadhar Housing Finance, PNC Infra — Check Gaurav Sharma's Top Stock Picks
description: Gaurav Sharma, associate VP and head of research at Globe Capital, recommends buying these stocks on Monday.

headline: Stay invested, sharp dip unlikely unless global shocks emerge: Sandip Sabharwal
description: Sandip Sabharwal suggests a positive market trend, driven by inflation undershooting RBI expectations and a weakening US dollar boosting emerging markets. While markets aren't cheap, corrections should be viewed as buying opportunities. He expresses skepticism about Eternal's quick commerce investments and notes the early monsoon's potential impact on various sectors. Divi's Laboratories looks promising, while Sun Pharma faces near-term challenges.

headline: Commodity Radar: Gold consolidates amid an upward bias. 5 technical insights before making a trade
description: Gold prices dipped amid easing US-EU tariff tensions, but technical indicators suggest an upward bias. Key support lies at Rs 95,200 with resistance near Rs 96,700. Analysts advise a buy-on-dips strategy as volatility compresses, awaiting cues from US macro data and Fed Chair Powell’s speech. Domestic rupee movement and geopolitical developments may keep MCX gold resilient.

headline: Aegis Vopak Terminals IPO opens for subscription. Should you apply?
description: Aegis Vopak Terminals launched its IPO on May 26, aiming to raise ₹2,800 crore through a fresh issue of shares. Initial subscription rates were modest, with retail investors showing more interest than other categories. The funds will be used for debt repayment, acquiring a cryogenic LPG terminal, and general corporate needs, with shares expected to list on June 2.

headline: NSE Planning To Settle Matters With SEBI To Further IPO
description: In a letter dated Nov. 21, 2016, SEBI had approved the listing of equity shares on a recognised stock exchange, contingent upon compliance with applicable regulations and SEBI circulars.

headline: Tariff Threat: Trump–EU trade tensions ease, for now
description: Donald Trump temporarily delays EU tariff hike to July 9 after talks with European Commission chief, easing trade tension fears.

headline: Balkrishna’s Passenger Car Tyre Foray Sparks Investor Concern On Margins, Strategy
description: Balkrishna has historically operated in a niche market with limited competition and strong profitability.

headline: U.S. futures jump while Asian shares slip after Donald Trump delays tariffs on the EU
description: U.S. futures rose as President Trump postponed steep EU tariffs to July 9, 2025, after a call with EU chief Ursula von der Leyen signaled a willingness to resume serious trade talks

description: Nearly 30 companies are set to report their March-quarter results on Monday.

headline: Groww files for $700 million-$1 billion initial public offering: Reports
description: Groww, the Indian online investment platform, has confidentially filed draft papers with the market regulator for an IPO aiming to raise between $700 million and $1 billion. The IPO will include a fresh issue of shares and stake sales by existing investors.

headline: India rate cut bets cap upward move in bond yields post RBI surplus letdown
description: Indian government bond prices recovered from initial losses on Monday, buoyed by expectations of further monetary policy easing despite a lower-than-expected surplus transfer from the Reserve Bank of India. Traders anticipate at least 50 basis points more in rate cuts in the coming months. Investors are now awaiting India's GDP data and the central bank's policy decision in early June.

headline: Rupee jumps 40 paise to 85.05 against US dollar in early trade
description: The Indian Rupee saw a significant rise against the US dollar in early trading. This appreciation is supported by a weaker dollar index and positive movement in domestic stock markets. Foreign fund inflows and a large dividend announcement from the Reserve Bank of India also boosted the rupee. Market participants are awaiting key economic data releases this week.

headline: The OPEC+ Dilemma: Balancing Production and Market Stability
Balkrishna Industries shares slump 10% after Q4FY25 PAT drops 25% YoY
description: Balkrishna Industries shares: Although the company's revenue grew by 5% year-on-year to Rs 2,838 crore and EBITDA edged up by 1% to Rs 703 crore, its EBITDA margin declined by 115 basis points year-on-year, settling at 24.78%.

description: Experts say the early arrival of monsoon and the RBI’s announcement of a record ₹2.69 lakh crore dividend to the government for FY25, have added to the optimism of the stock markets.

headline: Sensex Rises Over 700 Points In Early Trade As Trump Delays EU Tariffs
description: The domestic benchmark indices opened higher today as India achieving a new high in the world's largest economy ranking boosted investors' sentiment.

headline: Buy Honasa Consumer, target price Rs 400:  ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities recommends buying Honasa Consumer shares, setting a target price of Rs 400. The firm anticipates revenue growth for Honasa. They project significant increases in EBITDA and PAT through FY27. While reducing FY26 EPS estimates, ICICI Securities maintains a positive outlook. Key risks include competition and execution challenges. The brokerage reaffirms its BUY rating, citing potential for margin recovery.

headline: Groww Confidentially Files Draft Papers For IPO
description: "The filing of the pre-filed draft red herring prospectus shall not necessarily mean that the company will undertake the initial public offering," Groww said.

headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge Vs iPhone 16: Check Features, Price And Performance
description: Curious about how the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge compares to the iPhone 16 in design, power, photography and price? Check key specifications here.

description: JK Cements Ltd. shares rose the most, while Dreamfolks Ltd. fell the most, among the companies that announced their results for quarter ended March.

headline: Natural gas in 2025: A rebalancing market with growing global demand
description: Global natural gas demand is surging, driven by industrial growth in developing nations. The International Energy Agency reports a 2.7% rise in 2024, exceeding pre-pandemic levels. Asia accounts for 40% of this increase. Industrial and power sectors are key drivers. Despite rising demand, gas prices remain subdued. China's consumption is set to increase by 6.5%.

headline: JM Financial retains Buy on Sun Pharma, lowers target price to Rs 2,025
description: JM Financial maintains a Buy call on Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, setting a revised target price of Rs 2025. Sun Pharma's Q4FY25 results showed an 8% YoY top-line growth, driven by India formulations and global specialty sales, despite a decline in US formulations. Future growth hinges on Ilumya's Phase 3 data, Leqselvi's launch, and the Checkpoint Therapeutics acquisition.

headline: Gujarat Narmada Valley Share Price Jumps After Q4 Profit Rises
description: GNFC's net profit surged by 62.3% to Rs 211 crore, compared to Rs 130 crore in the previous year.

headline: OpenAI To Set Up Shop In South Korea To Spur Further Growth
description: The country would be OpenAI’s third office in Asia, following Japan and Singapore.

headline: Rs 7 lakh crore boom in just 10 days! Is the smallcap stocks party getting out of hand?
description: Smallcap stocks have surged, adding Rs 7.3 lakh crore to investor wealth in just 10 sessions, fueled by stock-specific triggers and retail investor enthusiasm. While some experts see justified valuations due to growth, others caution against stretched valuations and potential herd behavior, highlighting the risks of chasing momentum after a prior correction. The rally's sustainability remains questionable.

headline: Ashok Leyland Share Price Slides Despite Robust Q4 Financials, Brokerages Largely Positive
description: Ashok Leyland's board also approved a bonus issue of equity shares in 1:1 ratio on Friday.

headline: Trump Says He’s Weighing Russia Sanctions, Calls Putin ‘Crazy’
description: Trump in a Truth Social post later on Sunday said that Putin “has gone absolutely CRAZY!”

headline: Sensex surges 700 points, Nifty tops 25K on global cues; bank, auto stocks rise
description: Indian stock markets surged on Monday, with Sensex and Nifty50 opening higher, fueled by gains in banking and auto sectors. This positive momentum followed U.S. President Trump's decision to extend trade talks with the European Union, alleviating immediate trade concerns. M&M, Power Grid, and ICICI Bank were among the top gainers on the Sensex.

headline: Nibe shares hit 5% upper circuit on securing Rs 151 crore defence order from Israeli OEM
description: Nibe shares: The contract covers the production and supply of Universal Rocket Launchers with a range of up to 300 kilometres—an advanced system being manufactured in India for the first time for international use.

headline: Bullish Momentum: 6 stocks with White Marubozu Pattern on May 23
description: A White Marubozu occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.

headline: Bharti Airtel shares in focus after SC verdict on Rs 585 cr entertainment tax case
description: The Supreme Court dismissed Bharti Telemedia’s appeal in a Rs 585 crore entertainment tax case. The court upheld the states' rights to levy taxes on DTH services. While most of the liability was provisioned, the ruling may have wider regulatory implications. The verdict pertains to pre-GST dues, as entertainment tax is now subsumed.

headline: Stocks to buy today: Axis Bank, BHEL among top 5 trading ideas for 26 May 2025
description: Nifty futures ended Friday with a 0.96% gain at 24,890, while India VIX edged up slightly to 17.28 in the previous session.

headline: Rupee Recovers To Strengthen Against Dollar At Open
description: The outflows of MSCI tomorrow could be a trigger for rupee to weaken a bit from tomorrow, said Bhansali.

headline: VRL Logistics Q4 Review: Profitability Throws Up Surprises, But At Cost Of Volumes, Says HSBC
description: VRL Logistics' Q4 profit after tax grew by 245% year-on-year, significantly beating Bloomberg consensus expectations by 53%.

headline: These 4 stocks rose above VWAP on May 23
Tata Motors in focus as Trump delays EU tariffs; EV biz posts positive EBITDA
description: Tata Motors shares: The Mumbai-based automaker noted that its EV division is among the few electric mobility companies globally to reach profitability before depreciation and amortization.

headline: MSE, NCDEX Dissent To Two-Day Expiry Plan, Asked To Submit Views To SEBI —Profit Exclusive
description: The exchanges urged the Securities and Exchange Board of India to instead allow each exchange to have its own distinct expiry day.

headline: At multi-year highs: These 4 stocks witness 5-year swing high breakout
description: A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe.

headline: ETMarkets Smart Talk: From 1,200 to 10,000 | Abhishek Banerjee charts the next decade of SME listings in India
description: Abhishek Banerjee discusses the SME platform's surge in listings, driven by companies seeking capital and liquidity. He anticipates significant growth, potentially reaching 10,000 listings in a decade, democratizing mid-market capital. Banerjee also highlights the challenges and opportunities for investors, emphasizing the importance of stock selection and the potential for institutional involvement.

headline: What to do with Honasa, Raymond, Dixon Technologies and 3 other stocks? Aamar Deo of Angel One decodes
description: Amidst global economic concerns and a US credit rating downgrade, Indian markets show signs of fatigue with profit booking visible. Investors are advised to tread cautiously, focusing on a 'buy on dips' strategy for Nifty and Bank Nifty.

headline: Lumpy valuations and slower EPS growth could cap market upside: Viraj Gandhi of SAMCO MF
description: Viraj Gandhi of SAMCO Mutual Fund suggests that Indian markets, despite nearing lifetime highs, may experience a range-bound movement due to stretched valuations and moderate earnings growth. He emphasizes that a sustained bull run requires stronger fundamentals and a valuation reset.

headline: Axis Securities maintains Buy on ITC, target price Rs 500
description: Axis Securities recommends buying ITC shares, setting a target price of 500 rupees. ITC's cigarette revenue shows strong growth, driven by volume increases. While margins faced pressure from raw material costs, strategic savings helped offset the impact. The brokerage firm anticipates continued long-term growth for ITC. The stock's current valuation offers a safety margin compared to its competitors.

headline: Eternal shares in focus after FTSE, MSCI cut stock weight; $840 million in passive outflows likely
description: Eternal shares: The changes follow a decrease in the Foreign Ownership Limit (FOL) for the stock. As a result, Eternal's investability weighting in the FTSE All World Index has been cut from 82.74% to 49.5%.

headline: Paytm shares in focus after Supreme Court stays Rs 5,712-crore GST notice against First Games
description: The interim relief granted to Paytm’s gaming arm, First Games, is part of a wider legal challenge to GST demands on real-money gaming platforms. The case centres on the classification and taxation of such platforms under the GST regime—an issue impacting several players in the online gaming industry

headline: Devyani International's Target Price Cut By Citi After Slow Q4 Same Store Sales Growth
description: Citi forecasts margin expansion for KFC.

headline: JSW Steel Q4 Review: Morgan Stanley Says Results In Line; BPSL Overhang Persists
description: Morgan Stanley believes that one of the key overhangs is JSW's Bhushan Power & Steel unit, with discussions underway for resolution.

headline: Ashok Leyland Q4 Review: Margin Beat Lifts Sentiment Amid Mixed Demand Outlook
description: CLSA upgraded the stock to ‘Hold’ from ‘Underperform’ and raised its target price to Rs 225 from Rs 190, citing strong margin execution and improved medium-term outlook.

headline: Container Corporation Q4 Review: Lower Volumes, Export-Import Realisations Weigh Margins, Says Jefferies
description: Jefferies estimates a 19% FY25-30 Ebitda compound annual growth rate, led by a 13% volume CAGR and a 50 bps annual margin improvement on average, driven by DFC benefits and operating leverage.

headline: RBI's Rs 2.69 lakh crore dividend may not impress markets in the short term. Here's why
description: RBI has announced a record Rs 2.69 lakh crore dividend for FY25, a 27% rise from last year but below market expectations of nearly Rs 3 lakh crore. The higher contingency reserve under the Economic Capital Framework limited the payout. While markets may react cautiously, this dividend strengthens government finances and supports fiscal deficit reduction and increased spending.

headline: LTIMindtree Share Price Live Updates: LTIMindtree's Closing Price Analysis
Golden Crossovers: These 3 stocks signal bullishness on May 26
description: These stocks' 50-day simple moving averages (SMA) crossed their 200-day SMAs on May 19.

headline: NTPC shares in focus after Q4 profit jumps 22% YoY to Rs 7,897 crore
description: NTPC reported a 22% YoY rise in consolidated Q4 net profit to Rs 7,897 crore, driven by a 3.2% increase in revenue to Rs 49,834 crore. For FY25, PAT grew 9% to Rs 19,649 crore. The company recommended a final dividend of Rs 3.35 per share. Analysts maintain a ‘Buy’ rating with a target price of Rs 344.6.

headline: Inflation, not consumption, will be the main driver for higher US yields: Lakshmi Iyer
description: Lakshmi Iyer from Kotak Alternate suggests that Indian bond markets might experience profit booking if US 10-year Treasury yields breach and sustain above 5%. While near-term market reactions are muted, persistent high yields driven by inflation could trigger foreign investor outflows. Despite concerns, a combination of debt and equity flows should prevent a significant rupee collapse.

headline: Markets poised for stability as earnings downgrades ease: Dikshit Mittal
description: LIC Mutual Fund's Dikshit Mittal suggests focusing on companies catering to the upper-middle class and affluent Indian consumers, along with selective domestic pharma. He is bullish on industrials and capital goods, particularly those in power generation and import replacement.

headline: Leela Hotels IPO: Price Band, Financials, Key Dates, GMP And More — All You Need To Know
description: The price band for the Leela Hotels' operator's IPO has been set in the range of Rs 413 to Rs 435 per share.

headline: USDINR volatility to impact domestic gold prices amid Trump's EU tariff shifts
description: Gold surged nearly 5% last week as safe-haven demand rebounded amid U.S.-EU tariff tensions and global fiscal concerns. Trump’s shifting stance on EU tariffs and falling U.S. dollar added to volatility. With USDINR fluctuations likely to influence local prices, traders eye resistance near $3,371. A breakout may target $3,435–$3,500, while support holds at $3,250.

headline: The curious case of Indian prediction markets
description: An explainer on why opinion trading platforms or prediction markets aren't regulated in India yet.

headline: Gold And Silver Rates Today — Check Prices In Mumbai, Bangalore And Other Cities
description: The price of the precious metal in Chennai topped the charts to trade at Rs 96,980.

headline: Nippon Steel shares climb after Trump offers support for U.S. Steel deal
description: Nippon Steel's shares saw a surge in Tokyo. This followed Donald Trump's backing of their bid for U.S. Steel. Trump highlighted the deal's potential to create jobs and boost the U.S. economy. U.S. Steel shares also jumped significantly. The deal is crucial for Nippon Steel's global expansion. It aims to increase production amid declining domestic demand.

headline: Stocks to buy in 2025: ONGC, OIL India among 5 stocks that could give 10-40% return
description: We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources.

headline: Euro rises, dollar recovers as Trump gives more time for EU deal
description: Following President Trump's delay of threatened tariffs on the EU until July 9, the euro and dollar strengthened against the yen and Swiss franc. This decision, prompted by discussions with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, calmed global economic concerns.

headline: Gold retreats from two-week high as Trump extends EU tariff deadline
description: Gold prices declined from a two-week high. This happened after Donald Trump set a new deadline for a trade deal with the European Union. He delayed imposing tariffs. Earlier, gold prices had risen due to safe-haven demand. This was after Trump suggested tariffs on European Union imports. Russian forces attacked Ukrainian cities. Israeli strikes also killed Palestinians in Gaza.

headline: Oil Edges Higher As Trump Extends Tariff Deadline On EU Goods
description: Oil has been trending lower since mid-January as the fallout from Trump’s sweeping tariffs and retaliatory measures weigh on the outlook for demand.

headline: Asian Shares, US Futures Rise On EU Tariff Delay: Markets Wrap
description: The yen and Swiss franc, major beneficiaries of the Friday move, retreated. A gauge of Asian shares rose at the open.

headline: Asian shares, US futures rise on EU tariff delay
description: Global markets reacted positively after Donald Trump delayed European Union tariffs. Equity futures in the US and Europe increased, mirroring gains in Asian stocks. This decision followed a phone call with Ursula von der Leyen. The move provides a temporary reprieve in trade tensions. Investors are now awaiting the US personal consumption expenditures price index data.

headline: Bank of India allocates Rs 2000 crore for IT upgrades
description: Bank of India allocates ₹2,000 crore for IT in FY26. The investment aims to upgrade tech and boost cybersecurity. Digital initiatives will improve products and operations. MD Rajneesh Karnatak emphasizes transforming the bank into a tech-driven entity. Automation efforts saved 12,000 manhours. The bank added 5.2 million mobile banking customers, reaching a total of 9 million.

headline: Stocks in news: Firstcry, Nazara, Swiggy, JSW Steel, NTPC
description: Markets concluded the week cautiously amid global uncertainties, with investors awaiting key domestic developments. Several companies are in focus due to Q4 results: NTPC reported a 22% profit increase, JSW Steel saw a 16% rise, and Ashok Leyland's profit grew by 38%. Hyundai, NTPC Green, and Swiggy will join FTSE global equity indices.

headline: GIFT Nifty up 40 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
description: The market experienced mixed trends during the week, initially correcting before anticipated firmness driven by macro and earnings support. A "buy on dips and sell on rise" strategy is advised until a sustained move above 25,000. FIIs were net buyers, and the rupee strengthened against the dollar, reflecting increased risk appetite.

headline: Leela Hotels plans Rs 2,500 crore IPO to reduce debt and expand operations
description: Leela Hotels, a luxury hospitality chain, is planning an initial public offering. The company aims to raise funds to repay its debt. The promoter group's stake will decrease after the IPO. Leela Hotels has shown revenue growth. The company operates several hotels and resorts under 'The Leela' brand. They plan to launch new hotels by 2028.

headline: Aurobindo Pharma, KEC International, Blue Dart Express Q4 Results Today — Earnings Estimates
description: Aurobindo Pharma is estimated to report a 9.4% jump in consolidated revenue at Rs 8,197 crore. KEC International is estimated to have a revenue of Rs 7,078 crore.

headline: Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Before Going Into Trade On May 26
description: Stocks in the news, key quarterly earnings, bulk deals update, and much more!

headline: Can NSE Clearing achieve financial independence before the NSE IPO?
description: NSE's listing plans hinge on resolving the financial relationship between the exchange and its clearing arm, NSE Clearing. SEBI has suggested NSE Clearing should become financially independent, potentially by directly collecting fees from brokers. This move aims to strengthen NSE Clearing's balance sheet and ensure its stability post-IPO, addressing concerns about its reliance on the parent company.

headline: Equity to passion assets
description: Passion assets are illiquid and need long holding period to earn sizeable returns; it is best to ‘invest’ in collectibles that are rare; passion assets are valuable when you have a themed collection

headline: Nifty likely to consolidate with key support at 24,500: Analysts
description: Nifty is expected to consolidate, finding support around 24,500, with a potential upside towards 25,600 if it decisively breaks above 25,200. Technical analysts suggest that sectors like chemicals, capital goods, metals, real estate, and banking & financial services may show resilience. Stocks including HDFC Life, ICICI Bank, and Tata Chemicals are anticipated to exhibit bullish momentum for short-term trading.

headline: Trump's new tariff threats show trade uncertainty here to stay
description: Investors hoped for trade war calm, but Donald Trump dashed those hopes. He threatened high tariffs on the European Union and smartphones. Equities dropped globally, and the dollar weakened. Business leaders now face ongoing uncertainty. Trump declared he is not seeking a deal with the EU. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent mentioned potential deals with other nations like India.

headline: Four major IPOs to hit the market this week to garner Rs 6,600 crore
description: The IPO market is set to revive. Next week, Schloss Bangalore and Aegis Vopak Terminals, along with Prostar Info Systems and Scoda Tubes, will launch their IPOs. These companies plan to raise over Rs 6,600 crore. This follows a slowdown in IPOs this year, after a strong performance in 2024. Many companies are awaiting regulatory approval to launch their IPOs.

headline: Avoid costly mistakes in retirement plans
description: Crucial retirement planning tips to avoid common errors and ensure a secure financial future post-retirement

headline: Titan set to add Rs 2,500 crore Damas facet to portfolio
description: Titan Co is in advanced discussions to acquire a 72% stake in Damas International, a prominent Gulf jewellery retailer, for approximately Rs 2,500 crore. The Tata group company has commenced due diligence, with the remaining stake held by Mannai Corp. The deal, expected to be finalized in the second quarter of FY26, aims to replicate Titan's successful CaratLane acquisition model.

headline: JSW poised to acquire Akzo Nobel India for $1.1 billion
description: JSW Paints is poised to acquire Akzo Nobel India, valuing Akzo Nobel NV’s stake at approximately Rs 9,000 crore. This acquisition will position JSW Paints as a significant player in both the decorative and industrial paints sectors in India. The deal, expected to finalize by mid-June, involves an open offer for an additional 26% of the company's shares.

headline: RBI may extend lending to NBFCs, MFs during crises
description: The Reserve Bank of India is contemplating expanding its role as lender of last resort to include NBFCs, mutual funds, and microfinance institutions during extreme liquidity crunches. This consideration stems from increased interconnectedness within the financial system and the potential for contagion.

headline: What does Nifty's surge above 200-DMA mean for investors?
description: The Nifty's recent surge above its 200-Day Moving Average signals a bullish trend among blue-chip stocks, though optimism isn't universal. Axis Securities reports 226 of the top 500 stocks are trading above this key indicator, up from 95 in March.

headline: What short selling is all about in stock markets
description: For beginners, the concept of shorting can be extremely risky if the stock is liquid, as it would be very difficult to square-off positions, forcing them to pay heavy penalties

headline: Vigil over unsecured loans may weigh on credit growth: Binod Kumar, MD, Indian Bank
description: The Indian retail credit industry remains far from saturation due to several factors. The country continues to add many working-age citizens, particularly millennials and Gen Z, who have better incomes and changing spending habits. Increased global integration and upward social mobility have significantly influenced consumer behaviour, creating new demand for credit, says Indian Bank managing director Binod Kumar.

headline: ARCs seek bigger role in RBI's new securitisation framework
description: The RBI's draft allows pooling and securitising stressed retail and corporate loans, barring categories like farm loans, education loans, fraud, and wilful defaults. Investors must not be related to borrowers or disqualified under IBC norms.

description: The uncertainty is deterring not only foreign investors but Indian companies too, the Congress leader says, quoting RBI data

description: Justin Connolly will serve as the emissary between YouTube and the world of traditional media and entertainment.

headline: ONGC Makes Promising Oil, Gas Discoveries In Mumbai Offshore
description: New discoveries — Suryamani and Vajramani — in Mumbai Offshore basin signal potential boost to ONGC’s output

headline: Smallcap surge or mere illusion? Rupak De decodes trends in broader market
description: A handful of quality names are pulling up the smallcap and midcap indices, creating the illusion of broad strength and leading to outperformance versus the headline indices, says Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities.

headline: IPO Tracker: Leela Hotels, Aegis Vopak Terminals To Open This Week
description: Apart from the mainboard action, a number of SME IPOs are scheduled to open this week, including those of Blue Water Logistics, Neptune Petrochemicals and Astonea Labs.
